## 2. Activity 1: Building Documentation website using MkDocs Materials.

docs.title: 1. Install Prerequisites
docs.text: • Install Python version 3.8 or later. • Install MkDocs and the Material theme using pip. "pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material"

docs.title: 2. Create a New MkDocs Project
docs.text: Create a new documentation project and move into the project directory. mkdocs new my-docs "cd my-docs"

docs.title: 3. Enable the Material Theme
docs.text: Edit the mkdocs.yml configuration file to enable the Material theme. "site_name: Project Documentation theme: name: material"

docs.title: 4. Write Documentation Content
docs.text: • All documentation pages are written in Markdown. • Place Markdown files inside the docs/ directory. docs/ index.md introduction.md hardware.md software.md

docs.title: 5. Configure Navigation
docs.text: Define site navigation in mkdocs.yml to organize pages. nav: - Home: index.md - Introduction: introduction.md - Hardware Design: hardware.md - Software Design: software.md

docs.title: 6. Preview the Website Locally
docs.text: Run the development server to preview changes in real time. "mkdocs serve"

docs.title: 7. Enable Material Features (Optional)
docs.text:
features:

  • navigation.tabs
  • navigation.top
  • search.suggest
  • content.code.copy

docs.title: 8. Add Recommended Markdown Extensions
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:

  • admonition
  • toc: permalink: true
  • pymdownx.superfences
  • pymdownx.highlight

docs.title: 9. Build the Static Website
docs.text: Generate the static site files. "mkdocs build"

docs.title: 10. Deploy the Documentation Website
docs.text: • Deploy to GitHub Pages using MkDocs built-in support. • Alternatively deploy to Netlify, Vercel, or a local server. "mkdocs gh-deploy"

docs.title: 2. Activity of Day 2: Digital modeling for Fabrication
1. Introduction
docs.text:
a digital model is a visual representation of a designed and printed object. it's also a set of instructions for machines. this reduces the issues of fabrication cost failures due to the modeling production in mind.

## 2. Precision Modeling and Scale Control Precision modeling scale Control means Accurate Dimensions, Parametric Constrains and Real-World scale. Tools like "FreeCAD" empower designers with exact measurements, constraint-based sketches, and editable parameters, translating conceptual designs into tangible realities with unwavering accuracy

docs.title: 3. 3D Modeling for Fabrication (FreeCAD Example)
docs.text:
Key Practices: • Fully constrained sketches prevent unintended changes.

• Parametric dimensions allow for easy design modifications.

• Exclusive use of solid modeling ensures physical integrity.

A visually correct model may still be fabrication-incorrect. Focus on structural integrity and machine readability, not just aesthetic appeal, to guarantee successful physical output.

docs.title: 4. Activity of Day 4: Materials and Fabrication Methodes
1. Understanding Materials through Making
docs.text: For Day 4 Activity, we were supposed to understand the intersection of Materials and fabrication methods. this is where the actions meets it's place of work or field. As learners we have to understand the materials components and the exact methods to use on that particular objects.

docs.title: 2. Why is this important?
docs.text: Materials are not just components; they are the foundation of what we create. They dictate durability, functionality, and even sustainability. The choices made here ripple through the entire product lifecycle. 1. They describe the durability of the designed object. 2. have a clear understanding of how the formation and cost efficiency must match.

docs.title: 3. Material Properties & Selection
docs.text:
Material selection also is one of the key aspect of modeling and fabrication techniques which reduces the cost failure occurs in the designing process.

  1. Key Material Properties • Strength & Flexibility • Density • Thermal & Electrical Behavior

  2. Selection Depends On • Intended Function • Fabrication Method • Environment of Use

  3. Strategic Approach Choose materials based on performance requirements, not just aesthetic appeal.

docs.title: 4. Conclusion
docs.text:
Materials and Fabrication Methods Aspect aims to understand first of all the material to be used for example like the texture of a PCB board materials before drilling and designing circuit onit, to understand what makes materials that are used for 3D printing, how thickness and reliable they are. All these information gathered together for facilitating the Fabrication process of the those materials.

docs.title: 5. Activity of Day 5: Digital Fabrication: Laser Cutting
1. Introduction
docs.text: CNC and Laser Cutting is a task considered as shaping the material that have designed through softwares. Lase cutting is one of the Digital Fabrication task that is implemented for shaping the devices through the presicions.

docs.title: 2. Key apects for considerations for CNC and Laser cutting method.
docs.text:
1. Precision & Versatility Laser cutting employs a high-powered,focused beam to precisely cut, engrave,or mark a wide array of materials

  2. Diverse Applications From delicate wood and robust acrylic to plastics, leather, and thin metals, laser technology offers broad material compatibility.

docs.title: 3. Key Advantages
docs.text:
Benefits include : 1. unparalleled precision 2. remarkable speed 3. consistent repeatability, making it ideal for various industries
